Riparian Health - Shade: Mixed low and high level vegetation with an average daily effective shade ranging between 16-21% (an average height of around 25.5 ft., overhang of around 1.5 ft., and density of 42%).

Instream Flow (water use): 15% increase in flow from voluntary reductions in use and allowing that water savings to flow down the Jefferson River.

Reduce headwater temperatures: Decrease headwater temperature using the naturally occurring maximum temperature from the three headwaters streams (Ruby River at mouth= 66.70°F, Beaverhead River at mouth = 72.29°F, Big Hole River at mouth = 77.00°F).

actions.actionName: Beaverhead River (Grasshopper Creek to mouth) - Lower Beaverhead River and Upper Jefferson River Temperature TMDLs

associatedPollutants.TMDLEndPointText:
Riparian Health - Shade: Dense willow complex with an average daily effective shade of 22% (an average height of around 9 ft., overhang of around 1.5 ft., and density of 73%).

Instream Flow (water use): 20% increase in flow from improved irrigation delivery and allowing that water savings to flow down the Beaverhead River.

Wastewater Treatment Facilities: Individually or in combination no more than a 1.0°F increase when the receiving water is cooler than 66.5°F, no increase above 67°F when the receiving water is 66 – 66.5°F and no more than a 0.5°F increase under conditions where the receiving water is greater than 66.5°F.

Biological Indicator: Macroinvertebrate O/E ≥ 0.90

actions.actionName: White Pine Creek Temperature TMDL

associatedPollutants.TMDLEndPointText:
Water Temperature: The maximum allowable increase over the naturally occurring temperature is 1⁰F, when the naturally occurring temperature is less than 66⁰F. Within the naturally occurring temperature range of 66–66.5⁰F, the allowable increase cannot exceed 67⁰F. If the naturally occurring temperature is greater than 66.5⁰F, the maximum allowable increase is 0.5⁰F.

Riparian Health/Shade: Improve riparian vegetative communities along the modeled segments (river mile 3.7 to mouth) to a reference condition of mixed riparian forest/shrubs providing approximately 70% effective shade, as measured at logger WPC-T2.

Width/Depth Ratio: : ≤25; within the expected range for a Rosgen type C or F stream with <2% gradient.

Instream Flows: Application of all reasonable water conservation practices

actions.actionName: CARELESS CREEK TMDL

associatedPollutants.TMDLEndPointText:
■ NARRATIVE STANDARD: NO INCREASES ARE ALLOWED ABOVE NATURALLY OCCURRING CONCENTRATIONS OF SEDIMENT, SETTLEABLE SOLIDS, OILS OR FLOATING SOLIDS, WHICH WILL OR ARE LIKELY TO CREATE A NUISANCE OR RENDER THE WATERS HARMFUL, DETRIMENTAL, OR INJURIOUS TO PUBLIC HEALTH, RECREATION, SAFETY, WELFARE, LIVESTOCK, WILD ANIMALS, BIRDS, FISH, OR OTHER WILDLIFE (ARM 17.30.629(F))

■ BENEFICIAL USE STANDARD: ...SUITABLE FOR BATHING, SWIMMING AND RECREATION, GROWTH AND PROPAGATION OF NON-SALMONID FISHES AND ASSOCIATED AQUATIC LIFE, WATERFOWL AND FURBEARERS. (ARM17.30.6529(L))

[THE SUCCESS OF MEETING THESE STANDARDS WILL BE GAUGED BY MONITORING PHYSICAL AND BIOLOGICAL PARAMETERS SUCH AS: FLOW, TOTAL SUSPENDED SOLIDS, TEMPERATURE, CONDUCTIVITY, PH, AMOUNT OF BANK EROSION, STREAM CROSS SECTIONS, PEBBLE COUNTS, PHOTOPLOTS, MACROINVERTEBRATES, AND FISH. 

A GOAL OF APPROXIMATELY 155 MG/L SEDIMENT CONCENTRATION (SUSPENDED AND BEDLOAD COMBINED) DURING A STABLE FLOW OF 150 CFS HAS BEEN SUGGESTED AS A REASONABLE TARGET FOR AMBIENT SEDIMENT LEVELS.]

actions.actionName: BIG SANDY CREEK TMDL (LONESOME LAKE COULEE TO THE MOUTH - MILK RIVER)

associatedPollutants.TMDLEndPointText:
NARRATIVE STANDARD: STATE SURFACE WATERS MUST BE FREE FROM SUBSTANCES ATTRIBUTABLE TO MUNICIPAL, INDUSTRIAL, AGRICULTURAL PRACTICES OR OTHER DISCHARGES THAT WILL CREATE CONCENTRATIONS OR COMBINATIONS OF MATERIALS WHICH ARE TOXIC OR HARMFUL TO HUMAN, ANIMAL, PLANT OR AQUATIC LIFE (ARM 17.30.637(1)(D).)




A GOAL OF APPROXIMATELY 1000 MG/L TOTAL DISSOLVED SOLIDS (TDS)  OR  1600 ÌMHOS/CM SPECIFIC CONDUCTANCE (SC) AT 25 0 C.  (THESE METRICS REFLECT ABOUT THE SAME AMOUNT OF SALINITY IN BIG SANDY CREEK.)

actions.actionName: SAGE CREEK TMDL

associatedPollutants.TMDLEndPointText:
■ NARRATIVE STANDARD: STATE SURFACE WATERS MUST BE FREE FROM SUBSTANCES ATTRIBUTABLE TO MUNICIPAL, INDUSTRIAL, AGRICULTURAL PRACTICES OR OTHER DISCHARGES THAT WILL CREATE CONCENTRATIONS OR COMBINATIONS OF MATERIALS WHICH ARE TOXIC OR HARMFUL TO HUMAN, ANIMAL, PLANT OR AQUATIC LIFE (ARM 17.30.637(1)(D).)

■ BENEFICIAL USE STANDARD: ...SUITABLE FOR CULINARY AND FOOD PROCESS PURPOSES, AFTER CONVENTIALN TREATMENT, AND FOR BATHING, SWIMMING AND RECREATION, GROWTH AND PROPAGATION OF NON-SALMONID FISHES AND ASSOCIATED AQUATIC LIFE, WATERFOWL AND FURBEARERS, AND AGRICULTURAL AND INDUSTRIAL WATER SUPPLY. (ARM 17.30.625).

A GOAL OF APPROXIMATELY 1250 MG/L TOTAL DISSOLVED SOLIDS (TDS)  OR  1600 μMHOS/CM SPECIFIC CONDUCTANCE (SC).  (THESE METRICS REFLECT ABOUT THE SAME AMOUNT OF SALINITY IN SAGE CREEK.)
